an5.114:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Magadhans at Andhakavinda.
an5.114:4.2: Then venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
an5.114:4.3: bowed, and sat down to one side.
an5.114:5.1: “Ānanda, those mendicants who are junior, recently gone forth, newly come to this teaching and training should be encouraged, supported, and established in five things.
an5.114:5.3: They should be encouraged, supported, and established in restraint in the code of conduct: ‘Reverends, please be ethical. Live restrained in the code of conduct, accomplished in appropriate behavior and means of collecting alms. Seeing danger in the slightest flaw, keep the rules you’ve undertaken.’
an5.114:6.1: They should be encouraged, supported, and established in sense restraint: ‘Reverends, please live with sense doors guarded, under mindful protection and discipline, with protected mind, having a heart protected by mindfulness.’
an5.114:7.1: They should be encouraged, supported, and established in limiting their speech: ‘Reverends, please speak little. Put a limit on your speech.’
an5.114:8.1: They should be encouraged, supported, and established in retreat: ‘Reverends, please live in the wilderness. Frequent remote wilderness and jungle lodgings.’
an5.114:9.1: They should be encouraged, supported, and established in right perspective: ‘Reverends, please hold right view and have right perspective.’
an5.114:9.3: Those mendicants who are junior, recently gone forth, newly come to this teaching and training should be encouraged, supported, and established in these five things.”
